formattedAddress: 12 E 44th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 12 E 44th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text:
Dr. Shinhar did both of my sons surgeries.  He did a phenomenal job!!!!  They are no longer snoring!!!!  He doesn't have any fancy machines.  He is very experienced and into practicing real medicine
Very few doctors like him exist these days.  I Highly reccommend Dr. Shinhar!

originalText.text: If you want your kid to get proper care run away from this place. The doctor doesn't take the time to even have eye contact with you because he's busy just checking the paper, you are lucky if he spends more than  3 minutes with you

originalText.text:
Unacceptable  and unprofessional office , my daughter was referred by the doctor  Shai Shinhar, to do sleep study, for our insurance we need authorization,  I asked the office to send doctor's note to the sleep study office,  they didn't  send it, even though they said they did, I received  a call from other office saying that they didn't receive anything.
Manager of this facility hang-up  on me. I never experienced such unprofessional behavior  from the medicL facility.

originalText.text: If you have an option run away from this office and doctor!!!! Doesn’t spend time with the patient, looks in the paper while talking to the patient. It’s a long wait time in waiting area and in the room. The-only concern they have is the money. I never got any bills at home but every visit I’m there they come to me with “over due” payments.

originalText.text: These ratings are very subjective thing, My child was born with Underdeveloped lungs. I went to maybe 25 or 30 specialists, i went wherever I thought that my child could get better. In my travails I came across 2 Dr’s that helped us get our sons health on track. Let me be clear one of them could be seen as the meanest Dr I ever came across. Yet it was his persistence on us following his rules that he set down that finally enabled my son to grow. He saw us weekly and sometimes twice a week. If, I or my wife didn’t go and we sent someone else that person got an earful, he wanted us his primary caregivers at the appointments. We missed a few appointments and he threatened to stopped seeing us. He sat me and my wife down and said “you decide if you want me to help your son get better, if so you have to listen and do what I say” otherwise don’t waste my time. Today my boy is better, much better because of him. He recommended Dr Shinhar, anyone with Dr Jabbar’s recommendation, to doubt for me would be hard: I met Dr Shinhar today, thorough professional, he has an office fully staffed, I got there at 11:30 and was done at 1:00pm. Had I had to wait a few hours I wouldn’t have been overly upset. I’ve been around many many Dr’s I can pick out a good one Dr Shinhar is one.
